column5: Last year was the first year I noticed the bait, tackle and gas station was no longer there. I heard the building burned down. Is this true? Anyone know how this happened? Is there a plan for a new bait shop? I'm referring to the shop that was on the corner of the highway and highway 105 headed north to Ear Falls. LoDo
It is true, no longer in service...
I can confirm that it burned down. When we stopped last year no one knew if there was plans to rebuild.

Try a search for the Corner station. A couple years ago it burned down. If memory serves me it was a Labor Day weekend. I miss the Corner. We stopped there for gas and lures on the way north. We stopped there on the way south for gas and dry ice. Now we stop at Dutchies for beer on the wat up and the dry ice to keep the fillets cold on the way home. Oh yea don't forget the Cuban cigars!!
The last posts here talked about building in Dryden not VBay. A few years ago a youtube was posted.
Speaking of Corner Gas, anybody else enjoy the Canadian TV show of the same name?
One of my all time favorite shows. Had to order the whole 6 seasons on DVD. The bride and I both love the show.

The Village Corner was such a staple of our Canadian routine and we sure miss the breakfasts there. We are satisfied with Buster's, although it is really not the same. Tackle is available at Bobby's (bring your vaseline-it ain't cheap!) as well as basic groceries. We stay with Gayle at the Pine Grove on Fridays, she is a trip as well. That's how we do it! 9 freakin' days!
